text: English for professionals lesson 3 work
style in part 1 of this lesson we
studied these five words and expressions
work style work ethic work ethics
proactive fall into the trap of doing
something now let's review their
meanings I'll show you a definition and
you tell me the word or expression
taking initiative and not waiting for
people to tell you what to do proactive
the values people have in the workplace
a way of behaving at work based on a
sense of responsibility and honesty
work ethics you can also say workplace
ethics how you work best your approach
to work work style do something although
you know it's not a wise thing to do
fall into the trap of doing something
a belief that work has value and that
doing work builds character work ethic
to give you additional listening
practice with the new vocabulary I've
invited Dave secondo to join me once
again listening practice to listen and
answer the questions
work ethic have you heard of this before
this is an important thing to think
about what are your ethics do you
maintain your work ethics if not why do
they change and if they do change is it
justified watch yourself and don't fall
into the trap of being negative at work
of doing less than your best work style
one of the things that I learn from the
many mentors I've had is this self
motivation proactive it's important that
you find a way to motivate yourself if
you wait for other people to tell you
what to do all the time it's going to be
difficult to rise to the top
be proactive what does that mean
it means take the initiative make it
happen on your own don't wait for
someone else to tell you what to do do
more than asked and do it with a
positive attitude say hey it was my
pleasure what's next
that's the employee that we want to have
in our companies that's the employee we
want to promote
that's the employee that becomes the
entrepreneur the one that makes things
happen on their own so if I could leave
with a final note that I want you to
think about I want you to think about
this be proactive make it happen
yourself do more than asked and do it
with the positive attitude
that's something I've learned all I ask
is for you to think about it and think
about how you might be able to do that
in your own life if you're not doing it
already
now let's see how well you understood
Dave's talk question one based on Dave's
words do you think he believes it's
alright for a person's work ethics to
change based on Dave's words the answer
is no not really if he listened very
carefully to his words into his tone he
questions if a change in one's ethics is
ever justified to what trap or traps
does Dave warn others about
Dave warns us not to fall into the trap
of being negative or doing less than our
best
three according to Dave which quality is
needed to rise to the top
Dave places great importance on being
proactive not waiting for others to tell
you what to do for which statement below
reflects Dave's work ethic take it easy
just do the minimum work or exceed
people's expectations certainly it's the
second one exceed people's expectations
